info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 10:47AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...
Ouachita River At Monroe affecting Ouachita, Caldwell and Union Parishes.
For the Ouachita River...including Felsenthal Lock and Dam, Monroe, Columbia...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Major flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ouachita River at Monroe.
* WHEN...From late Friday night until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 45.0 feet, The Prairon Bayou recreational area floods and closes. Lowland flooding becomes extensive at this stage between levees.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 32.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 40.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning and continue rising to 45.0 feet Wednesday, April 23. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Caldwell, LA; Ouachita, LA; Union, LA
